newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks reduce losses after U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: French stocks reduce losses after U.S. data.

text.p: French shares reduced their losses further after the U.S. jobless claims figure was released.
Shares had been sharply lower following Wall Street's overnight drop.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was down 6.34 points or 0.25 percent at 2,543.91 at 1333 GMT while the CAC-40 futures contract was down at 2,541 from 2,546.5 on Wednesday's close.
* Generale des Eaux and Havas suspended pending statement. Generale is expected to sell its 19.3 percent stake in Canal Plus at 1,175 francs per share and take a 30 percent stake in Havas.
* Canal Plus was 0.17 percent lower at 1,170 francs.
* The CDR consortium placed at block of 14.9 million shares in Rhone-Poulenc at a reported price of 177.50 francs.
Rhone's stock was 1.79 percent lower at 181.20 francs.
* Fund managers said Belgium's Societe Generale de Belgique, part of Cie de Suez, was on the verge of selling its holding in Accor.
